main.name: Sam Musso
main.description: Please have a look around. Thanks for stopping by
main.bio: I have a keen interest in developing software that solves real-world problems with solutions that cross the real/virtual boundary. I am currently focused on furthering the state of the art in the entertainment automation space.

resume.skillmessage: Software is a bizarre world where code is king. The sheer vastness of the field is humbling and makes it rather difficult to pinpoint competency. However, I have recently found the Programmers Competency Matrix revealing that I am at Level 2 on most every category. I have reached Level 3 on a handful of categories and strive to expand that number.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Engineering: Computer Engineering

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: • C++/Qt5 design and development of the next generation world-class entertainment automation control system (taittowers.com/iq-navigator)

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: • Maintain company's custom embedded linux distribution (busybox, freescale BSP, Yocto)• Led the firmware and bootloader development efforts in successfully delivering Kickstarter's most funded photography gadget (Pulse) to 85+ countries & 12000+ backers. • Product supports the remote control via Bluetooth of 75+ Nikon & Canon DSLR models over USB2. • Ultra Low Energy ARM Cortex M0+ & M4 bare metal programming: system consumed 30mW of power at peak. • Led QA efforts. Wrote an end to end test framework to enable product verification. • Contributed to the design & development of the AngularJS hybrid mobile app (Cordova/PhoneGap) • Simultaneously maintained and supported three micro-controller based legacy products • Received an 8/10 review from Wired.com: “Pulse [..] is one of the best camera remotes you can buy.'

work.title: Software Engineer in Test
work.description: • Traffic tested Company's next generation network flow processors (NFP-6xxx) and enterprise-grade server blades using IXIA packet blasters on interfaces up to 100Gbps fiber • Tested the Company's enterprise-facing API. Tests were a combination of embedded C & python running on x86 and ARMv11 based platforms • Executed test plans on new releases of the Company's linux drivers, libraries, and utility applications • Maintained laboratory servers and machines running multiple flavors of linux (CentOS, RH, Ubuntu,...).

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.
